sponsor.partnerMessage: Ride the revolution with the American Heart Association Sept. 24 during the nonprofit's annual CycleNation event at the 8th Street Market in Bentonville. Teams of 4-6 ride relay-style on stationary bikes. A family bike ride is also available.

posts.title: Walmart Launches Be Your Own Model Experience
posts.content:
Walmart is ready to help you with your outfit of the day more than ever through its new virtual try-on apparel Be Your Own Model Experience. 

  • Tech: Earlier this year, Walmart implemented Zeekit’s virtual try-on technology with the “Choose My Model” experience. Now, customers can use their own photo and brings the in-store fitting room experience right to their phone. 
  • Function: The new feature works with more than 270,000 clothing items and is easy to use. Customers simply take a picture of themselves through the Walmart iOS app and use it every time they use the virtual try-on experience. 

Click HERE for more details.

posts.title: Electric Vehicle Event Coming To NWA
posts.content:
With Arkansas’s Electric Vehicle (EV) Infrastructure Deployment Plan underway, Electric Vehicles are in the near future for Northwest Arkansas. 

  • The electric way: An event in Rogers called Drive Electric NWA will educate the public all about it on September 24, focusing on the growing importance of electric cars, trucks, and e-bikes, as well as allow attendees to ask about issues, such as charging infrastructure or range anxiety. 
  • Giveaway: Drive Electric NWA will be at the Pinnacle Hills Promenade from 12-5p, and attendees will be eligible to enter a drawing to win a Vvolt Alpha e-bike provided by Moosejaw. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy weekend all! Here are some happenings around NWA: 

  • Fall market: Buy art from local artists and have a good time at the Fifth Market on Saturday. 
  • Tunes: Go listen to some live music at the Momentary this weekend. 
  • Pub Run: Drink, run, and repeat at Natural State Beer Company’s Oktoberfest on Saturday. 
  • Engage: INTERFORM’s Model Citizen: Rally & Register event is on Sunday from 2-6p. 
  • Rolling: The Color Roller mountain bike party is back this Saturday at Coler in Bentonville. 
  • Parking lots: A Walmart Baby Day event will be in Rogers from 10-12:30p on Saturday. 
  • Clean up: Join a Pick Up Where You Play event in Fayetteville or Rogers on Saturday! 
  • USA: Commemorate the ideals of our nation during Constitution Weekend at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art. 

Have fun, everyone, and be safe! See you next week!

posts.title: 43.5 Acres In Fayetteville To Become High-End RV Park
posts.content:
Arkansas Razorback and outdoor recreation fans are about to have a space in Fayetteville just for them. 

  • The land: Investors recently purchased 43.5 acres two miles west of the University of Arkansas campus to develop a high-end RV resort. The land is on the north side of Kessler Mountain Regional Park, less than a mile from Centennial Park. 
  • The park: The development name is Pigskin Park, and developers hope to break ground by the first quarter of 2023 to have it completed by the late summer of 2023. The park pads will have private parking stalls and entertainment areas and be fully equipped with electrical, water, and sewer hookups. The gated park will have Razorback gameday entertainment and shuttle service, a swimming pool, basketball and pickleball courts, and more. 

Read the Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • AcreTrader is looking for a UX Researcher*
  • TheatreSquared has a position open for a Marketing and Development Manager

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Munch: The BITE Experience @ the LPGA returns September 23-25 at Pinnacle Country Club. Tickets are almost sold out – get yours here!*
  • Anniversary: Social Brewing Project Co. is celebrating turning one year old and is inviting you to the festivities on Saturday.*
  • Scholars: Four Rogers high school students recently earned National Merit recognition. 
  • Hair care: Bentonville-based Dandymen is now on Walmart shelves. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.
